subject: Re: Reading and Writing Speed
msgSnippet: Hi, I would also be interested in an adaptation of QS to Swedish (or any scandinavian language). Kim
messageBody:
Hi,

I would also be interested in an adaptation of QS to Swedish (or any scandinavian language).

Kim

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "B. J. and Susan" <suebee2000_miss@...> wrote:
>
> John, (since your e-mail address doesn't show fully, please contact me @ bjdeberzsenyi@...), I would be interested in your adaptations of QS to Swedish and Melin to English.
>
>
> Â Take care,
>
>
> B. J.
>
>
> ________________________________
> From: Vincent Reilly <vin.reilly@...>
> To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Friday, April 12, 2013 8:37:04 AM
> Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Reading and Writing Speed
>
>
>
> Â 
> Dear Tim,
> Oh, snap!
> Now we can do a Humanist high-five!
> VinÂ  ;-)
>
> On 4/11/2013 10:10 PM, Timothy wrote:
>
> Â 
> >That, and I'm putting major works of fiction into it, starting with the Bible.
> >
> >http://sourceforge.net/projects/web-qs
> >
> >--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> >>
> >> The savings in physical effort are that much? I'm
> looking forward to that. So it is a private shorthand for
> you then?
> >>
> >> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@> wrote:
> >> >
> >> > If there is anything I write for myself in
> English (and occasionally Spanish and Esperanto, still
> working those out) I write it in QS. It saved me from
> carpal tunnel syndrome a few years back.
> >> >
> >> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> >> > >
> >> > > Hi Tim,
> >> > >
> >> > > Thanks for answering. Did you spend a lot
> of time per day at it? Do you still use it, and if so,
> what for?
> >> > >
> >> > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@> wrote:
> >> > > >
> >> > > > In my case, it took about six months.
> I was alone in my endeavor, which likely slowed me down
> since the only person I was communicating with was my
> future self. A friend of mine managed to master it in half
> the time since they used it to chat with me occasionally
> online.
> >> > > >
> >> > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> >> > > > >
> >> > > > > Has anyone achieved reading and
> writing speed with Senior QuickScript approaching what
> they could do with normal cursive handwriting? If so, how
> long did it take to get there?
> >> > > > >
> >> > > > > Thanks,
> >> > > > > John
> >> > > > >
> >> > > >
> >> > >
> >> >
> >>
> >
> >
>
